content.text: The Document Object Model (DOM) is a programming interface for web documents. It represents the page so that programs can change the document structure, style, and content. JavaScript can interact with the DOM to create dynamic HTML and CSS, respond to user interactions, and modify the page in real-time.

The DOM is not part of the JavaScript language itself, but rather a separate specification that browsers implement. This means that there may be differences in how the DOM is implemented across different browsers.
